results.title: Learning the butterfly stroke
results.brief_description: Shelagh Ratcliffe, national champion demonstrates the butterfly stroke. Children are seen at various levels performing a range of appropriate practices. Also demonstrates the racing start, a simple two hand “grab” turn, and the more advanced “tumble turn”.

results.title: Learning problems : diagnosis and action (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Edward Milner, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personality and Learning”.
Detailed account of some motor skills tasks, also concept and language tasks used for diagnosis and remediation with children showing specific learning difficulties. Demonstrates language master and Reynell language scales.

results.title: Learning lacrosse. Part two. Defence
results.creator_credit: Douglas Jackson, Walford Hewitson and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Using close-up, slow-motion and stop-motion, the film clearly demonstrates the tricks of play that might otherwise be too fast or complicated to see. Shows a series of defensive moves including cross checking and stick checking.

results.title: Learning in Britain
results.brief_description: No nation has a monopoly of knowledge but many centuries of learning and experience have made Britain a centre of study which attracts students from every part of the world. Famous places of learning are visited including universities, medical and agricultural schools, the great Inns of Court, and training colleges for teachers.

results.title: Learning from class discussion
results.brief_description: Presents a number of points on the value and necessities of worthwhile discussion. Emphasises that this organised conversation helps clarify ideas and provides for an interchange of information. Some of the elements of a good discussion are outlined for consideration by the audience.

results.title: Learning from Borobudur. Water and Romi = Air dan Romi. A Loving pinch = Cubit cubitan
results.creator_credit: Puskat Audio Visual Studio, Rapi Films and S E T Film Workshop
results.brief_description: Learning from Borobudur: A short documentary about the ancient Buddhist shrine in central Java, Indonesia. “Water and Romi”: This documentary was produced for the International Seminar on Water held in Jakarta in December 1991 under the auspices of the Goethe Institute Indonesia. Water mongers and river cleaners, amongst others, are interviewed in this look at life along the rivers and the worrying condition of water supply in the bustling city of Jakarta. This film was banned by Suharto’s New Order Government. “A Loving pinch”: An example of a dangdut musical drama made popular in its time mostly by Indian filmmakers. The dangdut form of music/culture entertainment is a favourite amongst working-class Indonesians, mostly men who traditionally come from a hard day’s work to relax to the music and gyrating hips of the singers. The film features established dangdut star, Elvy Sukaesih, as a mother who comes to Jakarta with her two children to look for her husband, only to find he has eloped with another woman. Separated from her children when the place they are staying for the night catches fire, Elvy becomes a star by sheer luck and is later reunited with her children. While this has been going on her husband has lost his job and is thrown out of his own house by the other woman. The compilation is in English and Indonesian with English subtitles.
results.title_for_label: Learning from Borobudur. Water and Romi = Air dan Romi. A Loving pinch = Cubit cubitan

results.title: Learning and living together
results.creator_credit: Cine Service and Melbourne Church of England Girls' Grammar School
results.brief_description: Pictures the activities of a modern girls’ school for 900 pupils, one feature of which is the provision of ample opportunities for social development. Each student is encouraged to develop her own interests and to find a goal before leaving school. The film shows learning by informal methods of class discussion and dramatisation. Re-enacts the entire school life of three senior girls, illustrating how in kindergarten they began to live and work together and how, as they grew older, each developed her own particular interests and abilities as a result of social learning - of doing things together.

results.title: Learning and growth
results.creator_credit: Arnold Gesell and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Attempts to clarify some of the principles which govern the learning process. The possibilities and limitations of training infants from 24 to 48 weeks of age are described. Several learning problems are analysed with special reference to the effect of maturity. The relationships between age, growth, and learning are indicated. Laws which determine learning in older children are outlined.

results.title: Learning about water
results.creator_credit: Gay Courter, Philip Courter, Stelios Roccos and ACI Films
results.brief_description: Uses simple experiments to demonstrate the scientific properties of water. Shows that water can change forms from liquid to vapor through evaporation and condensation. It also depicts, through use of a model farm, how it can power a water wheel, irrigate paddocks and cause erosion. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
